info.description: Build applications using the world's most powerful imagery
info.title: Getty Images

parameters.description: Provide a header to specify the language of result values.
parameters.name: Accept-Language

parameters.description: Provide access token in the format of 'Bearer {token}'.
parameters.name: Authorization

parameters.description: Name of artist for desired images
parameters.name: artist_name

parameters.description: Comma separated list of fields. Allows restricting which fields are returned. If no fields are selected, the summary_set of fields are returned.
parameters.name: fields

parameters.description: Identifies page to return. Default page is 1.
parameters.name: page

parameters.description: Specifies page size. Default page_size is 10, maximum page_size is 100.
parameters.name: page_size

parameters.description: Specifies the id of the channel for the asset data. Valid channel ids can be found in the results of the Get Partner Channel query.
parameters.name: channel_id

parameters.description: Specifies the number of assets to return. The default is 10; maximum is 500.
parameters.name: batch_size

403.description: Your access token does not authorize access to this resource

404.description: The channel you specified does not exist

parameters.description: Provide access token in the format of 'Bearer {token}'.
parameters.name: Authorization

403.description: Your access token does not authorize access to this resource

delete.summary: Confirm asset changes acknowledges receipt of asset changes.

parameters.description: Provide access token in the format of 'Bearer {token}'.
parameters.name: Authorization

get.summary: Retrieves the channel data for the partner. This data can be used to populate the channel_id parameter in the Put Asset Changes query.

parameters.description: Specify JSON containing an array of asset ids to register.  Limited to 500 asset ids per call.
parameters.name: request

200.description: Success - The assets were successfully registered.

401.description: AuthorizationTokenRequired - Authorization token was missing or not valid.

500.description: AssetRegistrationFailed - There was a failure when registering assets.

get.summary: Gets countries codes and names.

parameters.description: Provide access token in the format of 'Bearer {token}'.
parameters.name: Authorization

parameters.description: Provide a header to specify the language of result values.
parameters.name: Accept-Language

parameters.description: If specified, returns the list of previously downloaded images for all users in your company. Your account must be enabled for this functionality. Contact your Getty Images account rep for more information. Default is false.
parameters.name: company_downloads

parameters.description:
If specified, select assets downloaded on or before this date. Dates should be submitted in ISO
                8601 format (i.e., YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss.sss). If time is omitted, midnight is assumed. Date/times are UTC.
parameters.name: end_date

parameters.description: Identifies page to return. Default is 1.
parameters.name: page

parameters.description: Specifies page size. Default is 30, maximum page_size is 100.
parameters.name: page_size

parameters.description: Specifies product type to be included in the previous download results. To get previous iStockPhoto credit downloads, credit_pack must be selected.
parameters.name: product_type

parameters.description:
If specified, select assets downloaded on or after this date. Dates should be submitted in ISO
                8601 format (i.e., YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss.sss). If time is omitted, midnight is assumed. Date/times are UTC.
parameters.name: start_date

get.summary: Returns information about a customer's downloaded assets.

post.description:
The single step download call returns either a redirect or a response message with the URI to download the largest
                image available.
                Returns HTTP status code 303 Redirect to download URI or HTTP status code 200.

parameters.description:
<remarks>
                    Additional information required from specific customers when downloading. 
                    Only users who have been set up with a project code by Getty Images Sales need to use this field.
                </remarks>
parameters.name: download_details

parameters.description: Provide access token in the format of 'Bearer {token}'.
parameters.name: Authorization

parameters.description: Provide a header to specify the language of result values.
parameters.name: Accept-Language

parameters.description:
<remarks>
                    Id of image to download.
                </remarks>
parameters.name: id

parameters.description:
<remarks>
                    Specifies whether to auto-download the image. If true is specified, a 303 SeeOther status is returned with a
                    Location header set to the location of the image.
                    If false is specified, the download URI will be returned in the response message.
                </remarks>
parameters.name: auto_download

parameters.description:
<remarks>
                    File Type expressed with three character file extension.
                </remarks>
parameters.name: file_type

parameters.description:
<remarks>
                    Specifies the pixel height of the particular image to download.
                    Available heights can be found in the images/{ids} response for the specific image.
                    If left blank, it will return the largest available size.
                </remarks>
parameters.name: height

parameters.description:
<remarks>
                    Identifier of the instance for the selected product offering type.
                </remarks>
parameters.name: product_id

parameters.description:
<remarks>
                    Product type.
                </remarks>
parameters.name: product_type

post.description:
The single step download call returns either a redirect or a response message with the URI to download the largest
                video available.
                Returns HTTP status code 303 Redirect to download URI or HTTP status code 200.

parameters.description: Provide access token in the format of 'Bearer {token}'.
parameters.name: Authorization

parameters.description: Provide a header to specify the language of result values.
parameters.name: Accept-Language

parameters.description:
<remarks>
                    Id of video to download.
                </remarks>
parameters.name: id

parameters.description:
<remarks>
                    Specifies whether to auto-download the video. If true is specified, a 303 SeeOther status is returned with a
                    Location header set to the location of the video.
                    If false is specified, the download URI will be returned in the response message.
                </remarks>
parameters.name: auto_download

parameters.description:
<remarks>
                    Identifier of the instance for the selected product offering type.
                </remarks>
parameters.name: product_id

parameters.description: Specifies the size to be downloaded.
parameters.name: size

parameters.name: Accept-Language

parameters.description: Provide access token in the format of 'Bearer {token}'.
parameters.name: Authorization

parameters.description: Filters to events that start on or after this date. Use ISO 8601 format (e.g., 1999-12-31).
parameters.name: date_from

parameters.description: Filters to events that start on or before this date. Use ISO 8601 format (e.g., 1999-12-31).
parameters.name: date_to

parameters.description: Filters to events with a matching editorial segment.
parameters.name: editorial_segment

parameters.description: Specifies fields to return. Default set is 'id','name','start_date'.
parameters.name: fields

parameters.description: Request results starting at a page number (default is 1, maximum is 50).
parameters.name: page

parameters.description: Request number of images to return in each page.
parameters.name: page_size

parameters.description: Filters to events related to this phrase
parameters.name: phrase

get.summary: Search for events

parameters.description: Provide a header to specify the language of result values.
parameters.name: Accept-Language

parameters.description: Provide access token in the format of 'Bearer {token}'.
parameters.name: Authorization

parameters.description: Filter based on the age of individuals in an image.
parameters.name: age_of_people

parameters.description: Search for images by specific artists (free-text, comma-separated list of artists).
parameters.name: artists

parameters.description: Filter by collection codes (comma-separated list). Include or exclude based on collections_filter_type.
parameters.name: collection_codes

parameters.description: Provides searching based on specified collection(s).
parameters.name: collections_filter_type

parameters.description: Filter based on predominant color in an image. Use 6 character hexidecimal format (e.g., #002244). Note: when specified, results will not contain editorial images.
parameters.name: color

parameters.description: Filter based on image composition.
parameters.name: compositions

parameters.description: Restrict search results to embeddable images. The default is false.
parameters.name: embed_content_only

parameters.description: Filter search results based on the ethnicity of individuals in an image.
parameters.name: ethnicity

parameters.description: Filter based on specific events
parameters.name: event_ids

parameters.description: Excludes images containing nudity. The default is false.
parameters.name: exclude_nudity

parameters.description: Specifies fields to return. Defaults to 'summary_set'.
parameters.name: fields

parameters.description: Return only images having a specific file type.
parameters.name: file_types

parameters.description: Filter based on graphical style of the image.
parameters.name: graphical_styles

parameters.description: Return only images tagged with specific keyword(s). Specify using a comma-separated list of keyword Ids. If keyword Ids and phrase are both specified, only those images matching the query phrase which also contain the requested keyword(s) are returned.
parameters.name: keyword_ids

parameters.description: Specifies the image licensing model(s).
parameters.name: license_models

parameters.description: Filter based on minimum size requested.
parameters.name: minimum_size

parameters.description: Filter based on the number of people in the image.
parameters.name: number_of_people

parameters.description: Return only images with selected aspect ratios.
parameters.name: orientations

parameters.description: Request results starting at a page number (default is 1).
parameters.name: page

parameters.description: Request number of images to return in each page.
parameters.name: page_size

parameters.description: Search images using a search phrase.
parameters.name: phrase

parameters.description: Restrict search results to prestige images. The default is false.
parameters.name: prestige_content_only

parameters.description: Filter images to those having product types from the selected list.
parameters.name: product_types

parameters.description: Select sort order of results.
parameters.name: sort_order

parameters.description: Return only images associated with specific people (using a comma-delimited list).
parameters.name: specific_people

parameters.name: keyword_ids

parameters.description: Identifies page to return. Default is 1.
parameters.name: page

parameters.description: Specifies page size. Default is 30, maximum page_size is 100.
parameters.name: page_size

parameters.description: Free-text search query.
parameters.name: phrase

parameters.description: Allows filtering by a list of product types.
parameters.name: product_types

parameters.description: Allows sorting of results.
parameters.name: sort_order

parameters.description: Allows filtering by specific peoples' names.
parameters.name: specific_people

get.summary: Search for editorial videos

parameters.description:
Specifies up to 1000 sets of asset Id, usage count, and date of use to submit usages for. 
            Note that all asset Ids specified must be valid or the operation will fail causing no usages to be recorded. 
            The date format should be ISO 8601 (ex: YYYY-MM-DD), time is not needed.
parameters.name: request

parameters.description: Provide access token in the format of 'Bearer {token}'.
parameters.name: Authorization

parameters.description: Specifies a unique batch transaction id to identify the report.
parameters.name: id

200.description: Success - All usages reported were successfully recorded.

400.description: InvalidRequest - The content of the request was invalid. Most commonly this is due to either too many assets specified, no assets or invalid JSON.

401.description: AuthorizationTokenRequired - Authorization token was missing or not valid.

409.description: TransactionIdDuplicated - The id parameter supplied was already used in a previous usage report.

put.summary: Report usage of assets via a batch format.

parameters.description: Provide a header to specify the language of result values.
parameters.name: Accept-Language

parameters.description: Provide access token in the format of 'Bearer {token}'.
parameters.name: Authorization

parameters.description: Specifies one or more video ids to return. Use comma delimiter when requesting multiple ids.
parameters.name: ids

parameters.description: Specifies fields to return. Defaults to 'summary_set'.
parameters.name: fields

get.summary: Get metadata for multiple videos by supplying multiple video ids

parameters.description: Provide a header to specify the language of result values.
parameters.name: Accept-Language

parameters.description: Provide access token in the format of 'Bearer {token}'.
parameters.name: Authorization

parameters.description: A video id. For more than one video please use the /v3/video endpoint.
parameters.name: id

parameters.description: comma delimited list of fields to retrive for the video
parameters.name: fields

get.summary: Get metadata for a single video by supplying one video id

change_set_id.description: Contains the identifier for the change-set resource. Passed into ConfirmAssetChanges requests to confirm receipt of the asset changes in the response.

changed_assets.description: Contains a list of ChangedAssetList results for the query.

asset_changed_utc_datetime.description: Contains the date of the asset change.

asset_lifecycle.description: Contains the type of change this asset change is. (i.e. "New," "Updated" or "Deleted")

asset_type.description: Contains the type of asset this asset change is (i.e. "Image").

id.description: Contains the Id for the asset change.

uri.description: Contains the asset download URL for assets with an AssetLifecycle of "New."

how_can_i_use_it.description: Indicates how the asset can be used

usage_restrictions.description: Indicates asset usage restriction, if any

is_watermarked.description: Indicates whether the image is watermarked.

name.description: Identifies the name of the display size

uri.description: Identifies the URI for the image

asset_family.description: Specifies the asset family for the channel (e.g. "editorial" or "creative")

channel_id.description: Specifies the identification number for the channel

notification_count.description: Specifies the current count of notifications pending in the channel

RegisterAssetsRequest.description: Specify request containing the list of asset ids you want to register.

asset_ids.description: Specifies the list of asset ids you want to register.

asset_usage.description: Specifies the id, usage quantity, and date of when an asset was used.

asset_id.description: Specifies the Id of the asset that was used.

quantity.description: Specifies the number of times the asset was used.

usage_date.description: Identifies the date the asset was used, in ISO 8601 format (e.g., YYYY-MM-DD), time is not needed.

report_usage_batch_request.description: Specifies the request information for the Batch Usages endpoint.

asset_usages.description: Identifies the list of asset id, usage count and date of usage combinations to record.

report_usage_batch_response.description: Specifies the response from the Batch Usages endpoint.

invalid_assets.description: Identifies a list of asset ids submitted that did not match known Getty asset ids.

total_asset_usages_processed.description: Specifies the number of asset usage records that were successfully recorded.
